title: Cyber Monday cycling deals 2023: Sales go on post-Black Friday
content:
Cyclist
Cyber Monday cycling deals 2023: Sales go on post-Black Friday

Looking for great deals on everything you need for cycling? We’ve collected our favourite deals here, with some hefty discounts on cycling jackets, gloves and warmers, just in time for winter, as well as indoor cycling equipment and even a deal on inner tubes.

Wiggle and Chain Reaction kicked things off more than a month ago with an enormous sale and they’ve just added an extra 10% off with code EXTRA10 for ‘Cyber Week’ (when did it become a whole week? who knows), we have a specific guide to go deeper into that range that you can check out but have also included some of the best deals here.

Related Posts

Best road bikes: Best bikes from under £1,000 to over £10,000

Buyer’s guide: What to wear cycling in winter

Best gifts for cyclists: Presents for the cyclist in your life

Where to find the best Cyber Monday cycling deals

  • Wiggle and Chain Reaction Cycles: Categorically the best deals to be had, pages on pages of great deals.
  • Rapha: Save 25% sitewide and 35% off selected bundles with code BF2023
  • Le Col: Daily deals with big discounts and over 50% off a wide range of clothing
  • Proviz: Up to 75% discount on a range of the brand’s signature reflective outerwear
  • Ribble: Save up to £900 on the Ribble Gravel Ti, 20% on all Ribble’s Gravel, CGR and electric bikes and up to 80% on parts
  • Tredz: Save up to 46% on bikes, 65% on clothing, 69% on parts and more, plus extra discounts for spending over £100, £200, £1,000, £2,000 and £4,000 with code
  • Freewheel: 488 different products with up to 60% off
  • Saddleback: Up to 60% discount on premium brands including Castelli, Sportful, Sidi and Silca
  • Pearl Izumi: Up to 50% off and 25% discount sitewide for US-based purchasers, 30% for UK customers

Best individual cycling deals UK

  1. Vitus Mach 1 One SS bike: RRP £399.99 – Buy now from Wiggle for £159.99
  2. Endura Pro SL HC Windproof Cycling Jacket II: RRP £139.99 – Buy now from Tredz for £49.99
  3. Castelli Fondo 2 Long Sleeve Jersey: RRP £110 – Buy now from Tredz for £55
  4. Castelli Alpha ROS 2 jacket: RRP £320 – Buy now from Wiggle for £158.40
  5. Proviz Fully Reflective Jacket: RRP £99.99 – Buy now from Proviz for £69.99
  6. Madison Stellar Shine Reflective Waterproof Jacket: RRP £79.99 – Buy now from Freewheel for £34.99
  7. Onguard Pitbull U-Lock: RRP £54.99 – Buy now from Tredz for £29.99
  8. Altura Icon Rocket Insulated Gilet: RRP £60 – Buy now from Tredz for £27.99
  9. Shimano RC702 SPD-SL Road Cycling Shoes: RRP £189.99 – Buy now from Tredz for £94.99
  10. POC Omne Air Resistance MIPS Helmet: RRP £150 – Buy now from Chain Reaction Cycles for £50.40
  11. Lifeline Xplova NOZA S Smart Trainer: RRP £699.99 – Buy now from Wiggle for £225
  12. Lifeline Home Mechanic Wheel Truing Stand: RRP £79.99 – Buy now from Wiggle for £22.50
  13. Endura FS260-Pro Nemo 2 Waterproof Gloves Hi-viz: RRP £32.99 – Buy now from Cyclestore for £9.99
  14. Endura Thermolite Full Zip Legwarmers: RRP £32.99 – Buy now from Cyclestore for £17.99
  15. Le Col Oversocks: RRP £28 – Buy now from Le Col for £14.30
  16. Elite Custom Race Plus Bottle Cage: RRP £19.99 – Buy now from Merlin for £8.50
  17. Continental Quality Road Inner Tube: RRP £7.49 – Buy now from Wiggle for £2.70
  18. Bialetti Moka Express Coffee Maker: RRP £29.99 – Buy now from Amazon for £21.95
  19. Garmin Varia RTL515 Rearview Radar: RRP £169 – Buy now from Halfords for £135.20

The best cycling deals as picked by the team at Cyclist

Vitus Mach 1 One SS bike

£159.99 (RRP £399.99) | View offer

  • Singlespeed hybrid bike with cable disc brakes
  • Aluminium frame with hi-ten steel fork

This one kind of sells itself. A whole bike for £160? Madness! Don’t expect it to be particularly light, but this looks to be the perfect budget commuter or pub bike, and it’s available in all three sizes at this price.

  • Buy now from Wiggle (£159.99)

Endura Pro SL HC Windproof Cycling Jacket II

£49.99 (RRP £139.99) | View offer

  • Bold pattern with reflectives for enhanced road presence
  • Thermal insulation for comfort in cold, dry conditions

The Endura Pro SL HC Windproof Cycling Jacket II adds a little more insulation than the jackets above, for colder weather riding, but still has the same windproof/water resistant features. The back panel helps wick away moisture to ensure that you stay comfortable.

The bright pattern, which is continued onto the upper back, should help you to increase your road presence and is paired with in-built reflectives for low light riding.

  • Buy now from Tredz for £49.99

Castelli Fondo 2 Long Sleeve Jersey

£55 (RRP £110) | View offer

  • Quoted temperature range from 12-18°C
  • Room to layer up for cooler rides

Castelli reckons that on its own the Fondo 2 jersey is good for temperatures from 12 to 18 degrees C. Add a shell over it and you can go a lot lower. It quotes a weight of 255g for a size medium, so it’s not too heavy either.

Castelli describes the cut as a neutral fit, so it shouldn’t be pro-level tight and should allow you to layer up underneath. There’s a reasonable range of size/colour options on offer at Tredz.

  • Buy now from Tredz for £55

Castelli Alpha ROS 2 jacket

£176 (RRP £320) | View offer

  • Popular all-weather jacket
  • Gore-Tex Infinium fabric
  • Three rear pockets

Castelli has a boat load of deals on jackets at the moment and what better time to buy than just when the temperature really starts to drop. The Alpha ROS is one of the top tier items in its all-season range and with a price drop like that it’s hard to turn it down.

  • Buy now from Wiggle for £176

Proviz Fully Reflective Jacket

£69.99 (RRP £99.99) | View offer

  • All-over highly reflective fabric
  • Waterproof and adjustable

Proviz specialises in reflective clothing and this jacket is ideal for riding in low light conditions or in the dark. It’s made of a highly reflective material that’s also waterproof, with adjustable cuffs and waistband and rainproof zips to keep out the rain.

With a claimed 500g weight, it’s not too heavy either and would be a good option for commuting or if you like to head out in wet wintry conditions. A mesh lining and built-in vents help to keep your ride comfortable.

  • Buy now from Proviz for £69.99

Madison Stellar Shine Reflective Waterproof Jacket

£34.99/£39.99 (RRP 79.99) | View offer

  • Fully reflective waterproof jacket
  • Internal pocket
  • Dropped and elasticated hem

Another fully reflective waterproof jacket on sale is Madison’s Stellar Shine. It has a 10k/6k waterproof rating and plenty of features to keep breathability up without compromising on water resistance.

There’s also an inside pocket for dry storage, and the hem is both dropped for extra spray protection and elasticated to prevent flapping. The women’s jacket has an extra £5 than the men’s.

  • Buy the men’s jacket from Freewheel for £39.99
  • Buy the women’s jacket from Freewheel for £34.99

OnGuard Pitbull DT Shackle U-Lock Diamond Sold Secure

£29.99 (RRP £54.99) | View offer

  • Diamond Sold Secure rating
  • Comes with cable
  • Rubber coating to protect bike paint

You can’t get much better than a Diamond rated lock and the PitBull from Onguard is packed with features to deter and hold off criminals. It has a thick hardened steel shackle, Quattro Bolt Locking Mechanism (no surprises this means it locks at four points) and has more features to protect both your bike and the lock.

  • Buy now from Tredz (£29.99)

Altura Icon Rocket Gilet

£27.99 (RRP £60) | View offer

  • Windproof and water resistant
  • Mesh panels to add comfort when working hard

Packable enough to take with you if the weather is iffy, Altura’s gilet adds an extra layer of protection for your core from wind and showers if the conditions take a turn for the worse.

To keep you comfortable, the gilet’s windproof front panel and dropped tail are fleece lined for extra insulation. It’s also semi-fitted, packable and includes reflectives.

  • Buy now from Tredz for £27.99

Shimano RC702 SPD-SL Road Cycling Shoe

£94.99 (RRP £189.99) | View offer

  • Stiff carbon sole with low stack height
  • Two Boa dials for precise fit adjustment

Using Shimano’s S-Phyre tech, the RC702 shoe has a stiffness rating of 10 on Shimano’s scale and a double Boa dial closure allows you to adjust the fit precisely during a ride. Shimano quotes a weight per shoe of 240g for a size 42, so the shoe is lightweight. It has a low stack height and the extensive forefoot perforations ensure good ventilation.

Finding your size marked down can be difficult for cycling shoes, but there’s a reasonable range of sizes available in both black and white, including some half sizes, although the red colour option has a more limited size range available.

  • Buy now from Tredz for £94.99

POC Omne Air Resistance MIPS Helmet

£56 (RRP £150) | View offer

  • Added protection from MIPS Integra liner
  • Detachable peak for on/off-road riding

The POC Omne is a versatile all-rounder helmet and includes a removable visor for all-terrain riding. It has POC’s 360 degree adjustment system, for a dialled-in, comfortable fit.

The Omne includes MIPS for extra crash protection. The blue colourway in size small is just £50, but other colours are also discounted on Chain Reaction’s site. It’s only available in small though.

  • Buy now from Chain Reaction Cycles for £56

Lifeline Xplova NOZA S Smart Trainer

£249.99 (RRP £699.99) | View offer

  • 2500 watts resistance and 18% grade simulation
  • Compatible with Zwift and other training apps

This Lifeline trainer is half price currently, making it one of the cheapest wheel-off smart trainer options available. It’s BLE and ANT+ enabled, so it can be hooked up to a phone. tablet or computer to link to Zwift and other training apps.

With resistance up to 2,500W and the ability to simulate an 18 percent climb, there’s enough to satisfy the most powerful rider, while Lifeline claims quiet operation and +/-2.5 percent power measurement accuracy.

  • Buy now from Wiggle for £249.99

Lifeline Home Mechanic Wheel Truing Stand

£24.99 (RRP £79.99) | View offer

  • Compact, easy to use design
  • Works for wheels up to 29 inches with axles up to 135mm wide

Building or truing your own wheels is a deeply satisfying task, which requires a truing stand for the most precise alignment of the rims. The Lifeline truing stand provides a cost-effective option that’s easy to stow away when not needed and includes a calliper to make it easy to assess the wheel’s lateral and radial alignment.

The design can only accept wheels with hubs up to 135mm wide, so you’re not going to be able to true road or gravel bike wheels with 142mm thru-axles.

  • Buy now from Wiggle for £24.99

Endura FS260-Pro Nemo 2 Waterproof Gloves Hi-viz

£9.99 (RRP £32.99) | View offer

  • Warm and waterproof
  • Reflective with touchscreen fingertips

Neoprene is a good option for cold, wet weather riding, providing both insulation and waterproofing. The Endura FS260-Pro Nemo 2 Waterproof Gloves offer a touch of colour on a drear day too, as well as a good spread of reflectives.

The inside is fleeced for extra warmth and there’s a long cuff for plenty of overlap with a rain jacket, so they’ll help keep out the wet. There’s a touchscreen-sensitive fingertip, so you can operate your cycling computer effectively as you ride. Cyclestore only has the gloves available in XS, S or XXL though.

  • Buy now from Cyclestore for £9.99

Endura Thermolite Full Zip Legwarmers

£17.99 (RRP £32.99) | View offer

  • Full zip for easy on/off
  • Reflectives for added road presence

Endura includes a full zip in its leg warmers, so that they’re easy to put on and take off, either during your ride or as an extra layer to protect your legs before and after riding.

They’re held in place by top and bottom silicone grippers and coated to repel moisture. Endura says that the hollow fibre fabric adds a lot on insulation for its weight, wicks well and doesn’t get too heavy even if you are riding in the rain.

  • Buy now from Cyclestore for £17.99

Le Col Oversocks

£14.30 (RRP £28) | View offer

  • Close woven for wind resistance
  • Four colours available

If it’s cool and dry rather than cold and wet, oversocks provide a little extra insulation and help keep your shoes cleaner. Although the orange or yellow options will up your road presence, the black or navy colours are probably a wiser choice for grimy roads.

Le Col reckons that the close weave of the Cordura fabric ensures wind resistance and the tight fit will make your feet a little bit more aero.

  • Buy now from Le Col for £14.30

Elite Custom Race Plus Bottle Cage

£8.50 (RRP £13.99) | View offer

  • Lightweight fibre reinforced bottle cage
  • Good bottle retention and durability

Weighing just 40g, the Custom Race Plus bottle cage is made of fibre reinforced plastic and a good alternative to expensive carbon cages that will save you some cash too. An update of Elite’s classic Custom Race cage, the bottle cage is designed to ensure firm retention of a bottle even over uneven surfaces.

The Custom Race Plus cage is durable, looks good and has pro team endorsement, with Elite’s sponsored WorldTour teams. The shape and colour are similar to the Elite Vico Carbon bottle cage and the Custom Race Plus is just 15g heavier. The black colour will retain its looks well with use too.

  • Buy now from Merlin for £8.50

Continental Quality Road Inner Tube

£2.99 (RRP £7.49) | View offer

  • Quality inner butyl rubber tube
  • Wide range of sizes and valve options

Even if you’ve gone tubeless, it’s a fact of cycling life that sooner or later you’re going to need a spare inner tube. Conti’s standard tubes are good quality and not too heavy to carry around with you on a ride.

There’s a wide range of Presta valved tubes with 42mm length valve stems and covering tyre widths from 20mm to 47mm available on Wiggle, all with a discount. There are also reduced priced Schrader and Dunlop valve options. Prices for the most used options start at just £2.99, so it’s a good time to stock up.

  • Buy now from Wiggle for £2.99-£4.99

Bialetti Moka Express Espresso Coffee Maker

£21.95 (RRP £29.99) | View offer

  • Authentic Italian stovetop espresso maker
  • Larger sizes available

Make like a real Italian pro with this Moka Express coffee maker in two espresso cup size. Bialetti is the original espresso maker brand and its logo an icon. The Moka Express is durable with replaceable parts like the rubber seal as well.

There’s a whole range of sizes available with a similar discount, so if you don’t reckon that two cups will give you enough of a kick to get you steaming up the Apennines, how about 18 cups?

  • Buy now from Amazon for £21.95

Garmin RTL515 Rearview Radar/Taillight

£135.20 (RRP £169) | View offer

  • Combined taillight and rearview radar
  • Alerts you to approaching traffic

Halfords is offering 20% off a spend of over £130, which puts the price of this Garmin Varia at £135.20. As well as a taillight with four modes, the Varia includes a radar which will detect approaching vehicles up to 140m behind you. It will then transmit an alert to a bike computer, Garmin smartwatch or the Varia phone app to show you how far away the vehicle is and indicate how fast it’s travelling.

The Varia also changes its illumination pattern and intensity to alert the vehicle as it approaches. Once the vehicle passes, you’ll get an all-clear on your head unit. Claimed run time is up to 16 hours in dayflash mode.

  • Buy now from Halfords for £135.20

Shopping for someone else? Don’t miss our guide to the best gifts for cyclists.

author: jrobinson
